column4: any help getting two monitors to work on a laptop running hardy? i can only clone the screens but not extend desktop
what kind of graphics card?
intel i965
hit alt+f2 and type in "gksu displayconfig-gtk"
see if it gives you options for multiple monitors there
thanks to restart x to check it it looks like
ah.. i just tried grandr, which seemed promising but gave the error "user set screen width 2048, larger than max width 1024, set to max width"
i guess x has a maximum buffer size
that could be an xrandr issue.  there is an alternative in Xinerama i believe
give me a moment to check it out
ok i'll just rebooting anyway.. brb
still stuck in low graphics mode
i can't get up to native 1024x768 on the laptop screen any more
is it in failsafe mode?
hmm maybe
it will prompt you with a silly screen if it is.  What happened on start up?  Was this a restart attempt after trying to activate the external screen?
yeah it gave me a silly screen.. i think cause the second monitor was plugged in at boot and that confuses it.. should i just reboot again?
check out this: http://www.thinkwiki.org/wiki/Xorg_RandR_1.2#Using_xrandr_to_do_useful_things
i feel your frustration.  so, you're now back on the laptop only screen... can you jack up the resolutoin to the proper one again?
just laptop, and i can't
whats it do?
